New Records: Pete Alonso is the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run while trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all playoff game, per Opta Stats.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run home run in the ninth inning.
Back-to-back home runs in the seventh inning by the Brewers.
Devin Williams hit Jesse Winker with a fastball, and Winker stole second base and scored on a single from Starling Marte.
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-game insights were provided in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' comeback victory in the decisive Game 3 gave them their first playoff series win since claiming the NL pennant in 2015.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Every team to have eliminated the Brewers from the playoffs has gone on to reach the Fall Classic.
Others: The Mets will face the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS, marking the first time the two fierce rivals have ever met in the postseason. Game 1 of that series starts at 4:08 p.m. ET on FOX and the FOX Sports App.
